TopicTitle: BobCat Ind. - Colonization, exploring and research vehicle

Articles.Content:
KhaosCorp: you can convert any mbm to PNG. And KSP doesn't care what format its textures are in, so once you convert, delete the original MBM and the new png will be used as the texture. Or convert the PNG to TGA if you like that better.

BobCat: Looking good! As always, but I hope you know that
Any chance that wheel could be a slightly bit wider

Yeah, now, these latest images are looking much better, imo. The wheels look more proportional to the rover body now, and somehow they just look 'beefier', more able to stand up to the kind of abuse that I like to subject my rovers to, lol.
I'm really looking forward to this! Keep up the good work!
Oh Bobcat... you keep amazing us with the creations of yours. Your work is simply beautiful.

Looks great bobcat! I can't wait to try out that rover!

It looks like the chassis is a separate piece from the body, if it is can you add a bracket for a KAS winch to the front or back?

Edited January 13, 2014 by mostlydave

This is probably flogging a dead horse but...

MPSS Nautilus?

With most Bobcat mods, I need to change around some Part files, any clue on what to do here, or is the Nautilus and FLY 100% broken?

This is probably flogging a dead horse but...

MPSS Nautilus?

With most Bobcat mods, I need to change around some Part files, any clue on what to do here, or is the Nautilus and FLY 100% broken?

I think the Nautilus should work if you put PART{} tags around it and place it in the KSP/GameData folder, or you could just put it into your KSP/Parts folder, it should work without edits but won't be available in Career. The important word was "should".

I think the Nautilus should work if you put PART{} tags around it and place it in the KSP/GameData folder, or you could just put it into your KSP/Parts folder, it should work without edits but won't be available in Career. The important word was "should".

Thanks, I'll give it a shot

oh, and also, is it Ditto for the Jool V?

JoolV and MPSS/Fly work just fine if you do some simple config edits. I have been (and still am) using the fly extendable RCS quads on my tugs for about as long as I been playing KSP...those things are great!

Not 100% sure if the IVAs are working....

Really the parts just need the PART{} and career tech node definitions in configs.
Hey Bobcat, are you going to redo the MPSS Nautilus and/or FLY tug to go with the new HOME3?

Hey Bobcat, are you going to redo the MPSS Nautilus and/or FLY tug to go with the new HOME3?

I think he said he was going to, but I'm not sure whether he's started yet.

Does the PART { } go around the WHOLE thing, or is it just PART {

} around a blank space?

and that thing about 'Career nodes', what exactly is that?

Does the PART { } go around the WHOLE thing, or is it just PART {

} around a blank space?

and that thing about 'Career nodes', what exactly is that?

Around the whole thing, so basically, put 

PART {

on its own as the first line of the file, the all the original contents, then 

}

on a line of its own as the last line of the file.

Around the whole thing, so basically, put 
PART {

on its own as the first line of the file, the all the original contents, then 

}

on a line of its own as the last line of the file.

Thank you very much!

on another note, someone should provide Bobcat with files of all the fixed mods, so he can upload those files, and I assume he is a very busy man, not even having the time to do these edits.

(I'd do it for him)

As always bobcat you never fail to impress i cant wait to try it out ive been dying to use home since the .23 update hope to see it soon. Oh and aprox how many hours do you have in to coding and texturing this version?
btw the cockpit transparency mod "sfr Command Pod" http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/sfr-command-pod/ just got updated.
Any updates to this mod?

Any updates to this mod?

I can actually say no, and not feel wrong. Just look at previous pages to see what's in progress.

btw the cockpit transparency mod "sfr Command Pod"

That cool, but still have a lot bugs

Edited January 19, 2014 by BobCat

That cool, but still have a lot bugs

http://gyazo.com/b2a5f89aedd31c9136552cee9c40117a.png

http://gyazo.com/6a0c8b41dd264cf6e64da13828e410bf.png

I Like it. Especially the second one with the visible glass. Will this be just a single part like the old demv's? Or seperate parts like fusulage, base and wheels.

I have a small problem, well, two.

So, I downloaded and updated Nautilus and the HOME Powerplant, it worked good, then I downloaded and updated Jool V the same way I did with the powerplant and Nautilus. Then the Powerplant wouldn't load on the loading screen, even after I updated it. This never happened Prior to Jool V. Then I deleted the powerplant to actually get into KSP, and then, as soon as I got into the VAB, my entire HUD was missing.

Oh, and after installing and Updating Nautilus, the stock part textures messed up (not like I'd be using them with all these mods)

Not sure about the HOME gen1 powerplant, but I can confirm if done proper all the parts from Nautilus and JoolV work just fine. Id go config digging if I was you...seems something may be amiss there. Keep in mind that even when the mod was current the powerplant always had some issues.

Well that's interesting... What's the hatchback useful for? Can you for example place a KAS box or something back there? Science equipment or experiments?

LOVE the visible cockpit area and even the Rastor screen images visible from outside! Gorgeous!
